name: RetrieveEventCompletions
description:
Retrieve instances of event completion data.

Use this tool to retrieve all event completions associated with a specific contact. Ideal for tracking event participation and analyzing engagement.

parameters.name: crm_object_type
parameters.description: Specify the CRM object type to filter event instances (e.g., `contact`).

value_schema.description: The type of CRM object to filter event instances on (e.g., `contact`). To retrieve event data for a specific CRM record, include the additional `objectId` query parameter (below).

parameters.name: event_type_name
parameters.description: The specific name of the event type to retrieve data for. Available event types can be found using the event types endpoint.

value_schema.description: The event type name. You can retrieve available event types using the [event types endpoint](#get-%2Fevents%2Fv3%2Fevents%2Fevent-types).

parameters.name: paging_cursor_token
parameters.description: The token for the next page of results, returned as `paging.next.after` in the previous response.

value_schema.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: paging_before_token
parameters.description: The cursor token to fetch results occurring before this point when paginating results.

parameters.name: max_results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Specify the sort direction for event instances based on the timestamp. Use `ASCENDING` or `DESCENDING`.

value_schema.description: Sort direction based on the timestamp of the event instance, `ASCENDING` or `DESCENDING`.

parameters.name: filter_occurred_after_datetime
parameters.description: Filter for event data occurring after a specific datetime, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2023-01-01T00:00:00Z').

value_schema.description: Filter for event data that occurred after a specific datetime.

parameters.name: filter_events_occurred_before
parameters.description: Filter for events that occurred before a specific datetime. Accepts an ISO 8601 formatted date-time string.

value_schema.description: Filter for event data that occurred before a specific datetime.

parameters.name: crm_object_id
parameters.description: The ID of the CRM Object to filter event instances on. Must be used with `object_type`.

value_schema.description: The ID of the CRM Object to filter event instances on. When including this parameter, you must also include the `objectType` parameter.

parameters.name: unique_identifier_property
parameters.description: Specify a unique identifier for a CRM object. For contacts, use the email property (e.g., `email=name@domain.com`).

value_schema.description: Instead of retrieving event data for a specific object by its ID, you can specify a unique identifier property. For contacts, you can use the `email` property. (e.g., `objectProperty.email=name@domain.com`).

parameters.name: event_property_filter
parameters.description: Specify a key-value pair to filter event completions by a property (e.g., `hs_city=portland`). Use `%20` or `+` for spaces.

value_schema.description: Filter for event completions that contain a specific value for an event property (e.g., `property.hs_city=portland`). For properties values with spaces, replaces spaces with `%20` or `+` (e.g., `property.hs_city=new+york`).

parameters.name: event_instance_ids
parameters.description: List of event instance IDs. Each ID must uniquely match the event instance, and any additional filters must align with the event instance’s attributes.

value_schema.description: ID of an event instance. IDs are 1:1 with event instances. If you provide this filter and additional filters, the other filters must match the values on the event instance to yield results.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Hubspot Events API

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: The type of CRM object to filter event instances on (e.g., `contact`). To retrieve event data for a specific CRM record, include the additional `objectId` query parameter (below).

value_schema.description: The type of CRM object to filter event instances on (e.g., `contact`). To retrieve event data for a specific CRM record, include the additional `objectId` query parameter (below).

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description: The event type name. You can retrieve available event types using the [event types endpoint](#get-%2Fevents%2Fv3%2Fevents%2Fevent-types).

parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

value_schema.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort direction based on the timestamp of the event instance, `ASCENDING` or `DESCENDING`.

value_schema.description: Sort direction based on the timestamp of the event instance, `ASCENDING` or `DESCENDING`.

parameters.name: occurredAfter
parameters.description: Filter for event data that occurred after a specific datetime.

value_schema.description: Filter for event data that occurred after a specific datetime.

parameters.name: occurredBefore
parameters.description: Filter for event data that occurred before a specific datetime.

value_schema.description: Filter for event data that occurred before a specific datetime.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The ID of the CRM Object to filter event instances on. When including this parameter, you must also include the `objectType` parameter.

value_schema.description: The ID of the CRM Object to filter event instances on. When including this parameter, you must also include the `objectType` parameter.

parameters.name: objectProperty.{propname}
parameters.description: Instead of retrieving event data for a specific object by its ID, you can specify a unique identifier property. For contacts, you can use the `email` property. (e.g., `objectProperty.email=name@domain.com`).

value_schema.description: Instead of retrieving event data for a specific object by its ID, you can specify a unique identifier property. For contacts, you can use the `email` property. (e.g., `objectProperty.email=name@domain.com`).

parameters.name: property.{propname}
parameters.description: Filter for event completions that contain a specific value for an event property (e.g., `property.hs_city=portland`). For properties values with spaces, replaces spaces with `%20` or `+` (e.g., `property.hs_city=new+york`).

value_schema.description: Filter for event completions that contain a specific value for an event property (e.g., `property.hs_city=portland`). For properties values with spaces, replaces spaces with `%20` or `+` (e.g., `property.hs_city=new+york`).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of an event instance. IDs are 1:1 with event instances. If you provide this filter and additional filters, the other filters must match the values on the event instance to yield results.

value_schema.description: ID of an event instance. IDs are 1:1 with event instances. If you provide this filter and additional filters, the other filters must match the values on the event instance to yield results.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
